name: Pranam Chatterjee
content: Chatterjee Lab | Welcome to the Programmable Biology Group! top of pageThe Programmable Biology GroupWe develop novel generative algorithms and experimental modalities to design molecules for therapeutics and bioremediation.Our ResearchHome: ResearchProgrammable Proteome EditingWe are developing peptide-guided protein therapeutics to target disordered and "undruggable" proteins. To accomplish this goal, we train language models, such as SaLT&PepPr, PepPrCLIP, and PepMLM, to de novo design peptide binders to any pathogenic protein without needing its structure, and subsequently link these binders to post-translational modification domains to edit the protein. Our current peptide-E3 ubiquitin ligase (uAbs) and peptide-deubiquitinase fusions (duAbs) represent a CRISPR-like approach for targeted protein degradation and stabilization. We are now extending this to multi-objective-guided generation of therapeutic peptides with PepTune and MOG-DFM, as well as specific targeting of dysregulated isoforms with PTM-Mamba, FusOn-pLM, and moPPIt! Home: Our TeamOur TeamWe program biology to do what we want.Pranam ChatterjeeAssistant Professor of Bioengineering Assistant Professor of Computer and Information Science University of Pennsylvania MIT (SB '16, SM '18, PhD '20) Co-Founder of Gameto, Inc. Co-Founder of UbiquiTx, Inc. Co-Founder of AtomBioworks, Inc. pranam@seas.upenn.eduPostdoctoral FellowsLin ZhaoPhD (Fudan '20)Liz MahoodPhD (Cornell '23)PhD StudentsLauren HongBS (Georgia Tech '22)Zachary QuinnBS (SUNY Binghamton '20)Sophie VincoffBS (Duke '23)Tian WangBS (UNC '24)Yinuo ZhangBS (UC Davis '20)Tong ChenBS (Fudan '25)Masters StudentsHoward LiuBS (Emory '24)Yesol KimBS (Korea U '24)Rosie ZhangBS (Fudan '25)Sumi KimuraBS (UC Davis '24)Jiale ChenBS (UC Santa Barbara '25)UndergraduatesSophia TangPenn '27Shrey GoelDuke '27Divya SrijayDuke '27Our Alumni Graduate Students Tianlai (Leo) Chen, MS (Duke '24) → PhD Student at Harvard Zhangzhi (Fred) Peng, BS (ECJTU '24) → PhD Student at Duke Research Associates Rio Watson, MS (KyotoU '23) → PhD Student at NTU Singapore Undergraduate Students​ Sabrina Koseki, BA (Wellesley '22) → PhD Student at Penn Kalyan Palepu, AB (Harvard '23) → ML Engineer at D.E.
